‘Ruby 2’ is a gourmet, dual-purpose baby beet cultivar perfected for rapid cycling and high-density container production. This dwarf variety forms perfectly spherical, deep crimson roots no larger than a ping-pong ball, accompanied by a prolific bunch of tender, dark green leaves with vibrant red veins. Bred for exceptional sweetness and minimal earthy bitterness, ‘Ruby 2’ delivers the full, rich flavour of a mature beet in a miniature, space-efficient package, ensuring no part of the plant goes to waste.

Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Ruby 2’ offers a remarkably sweet, earthy flavour with subtle nutty undertones and very low geosmin content, the compound responsible for strong earthy notes. The roots are perfectly round, smooth-skinned, and intensely ruby-red throughout, with no internal zoning or woodiness. The greens are tender, glossy, and have a flavour similar to Swiss chard, but more delicate and less pungent.

2. The Dual-Harvest Gourmet This beet’s value is in its complete usability, providing two distinct, high-quality crops from a single plant.

  • Whole Roasted or Glazed: Their small size allows them to be roasted or steamed whole, becoming meltingly tender and intensely sweet, perfect for salads or as a glazed side dish.
  • Pickled and Preserved: The classic use for baby beets, creating vibrant, sweet-and-sour pickles that retain their firm texture and beautiful colour.
  • Fresh Greens Sauté: The young leaves and stems can be harvested continuously and sautéed with garlic as a nutrient-dense side, or used raw in salads when very young.
  • Vibrant Purees and Hummus: Creates the most brilliantly coloured, sweet purees, soups, and vibrant pink hummus.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Ruby 2’ is a fast-maturing, determinate-type beet. For a dual harvest, young greens can be carefully picked without harming the developing root. The primary root harvest occurs when they reach 3-4 cm in diameter. Supplied as an RFID seed tape, a single planting provides a dense and uniform yield of 5-8 perfectly formed baby beets and a substantial bunch of greens, with roots ready for harvest in just 45-50 days from sowing.

The Science & Story Behind It

The success of ‘Ruby 2’ is founded on its accelerated sugar development, uniform shape, and reduced geosmin production.

  • The rapid development and intense sweetness are due to a highly efficient photosynthesis-to-sucrose conversion pathway in the root, alongside a gene that promotes early and uniform root bulking, preventing the toughness that can occur in slower-growing beets.
  • The perfect spherical shape is a result of selecting for a symmetrical root meristem and a thin, delicate taproot, allowing the storage root to form a uniform ball ideal for container growth and consistent cooking times.
  • The mild flavour in both roots and greens is achieved by selecting for low geosmin levels and a favourable balance of oxalic acid in the leaves, resulting in a sweeter, less earthy root and a more palatable, tender green.

In short, Baby Beet ‘Ruby 2’ is a sweet, dual-purpose, and space-smart variety, a genetic refinement that offers a rapid, bountiful, and beautiful harvest of roots and greens from the most compact of growing spaces.
